SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.fx.controls

Class InputControlState<R>

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.fx.controls.InputControlState<R>
Type Parameters:
R - the type of the value being managed
public final class InputControlState<R> extends Object
The InputControlState class encapsulates the value, validation logic, error message, and validity state of an InputControl.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputControlState

      public InputControlState(javafx.beans.property.Property<@Nullable R> value, Supplier<? extends @Nullable R> dflt)
      Constructs a State object with the given value and default value supplier.
      Parameters:
      value - the property representing the value managed by this State
      dflt - a supplier that provides the default value for the property

    • InputControlState

      public InputControlState(javafx.beans.property.Property<@Nullable R> value, Supplier<? extends @Nullable R> dflt, Function<? super @Nullable R,Optional<String>> validate)
      Constructs a State object with the given value, default value supplier, and validation function.
      Parameters:
      value - the property representing the value managed by this State
      dflt - a supplier that provides the default value for the property
      validate - a function that validates the value and returns an optional error message

    • InputControlState

      public InputControlState(javafx.beans.property.Property<@Nullable R> value, Supplier<? extends @Nullable R> dflt, Function<? super @Nullable R,Optional<String>> validate, javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<?> baseValue)
      Creates an InputControlState object with the specified value, default value supplier, validation function, and base value.
      Parameters:
      value - the property representing the value managed by this State
      dflt - a supplier that provides the default value for the property
      validate - a function that validates the value and returns an optional error message
      baseValue - the observable base value, which may differ from the value property in certain contexts

  • Method Details

    • voidState

      public static InputControlState<Void> voidState()
      Creates an InputControlState instance configured to manage a property of type Void.
      Returns:
      an InputControlState instance with a property of type Void and default value supplier

    • addValidationListener

      public void addValidationListener(Runnable listener)
      Adds a validation listener to the State. The listener will be executed when the validation process occurs, allowing custom logic to be triggered based on validation events.
      Parameters:
      listener - the Runnable that will be executed during validation

    • removeValidationListener

      public boolean removeValidationListener(Runnable listener)
      Removes a validation listener from the state.
      Parameters:
      listener - the validation listener to be removed
      Returns:
      true if the specified listener was successfully removed, false otherwise

    • errorProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyStringProperty errorProperty()
      Returns a read-only string property representing the current error message. If the value is valid, the error message will be an empty string.
      Returns:
      ReadOnlyStringProperty representing the error message.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the state to its default value.

      This method sets the current value of the property managed by this state to the default value supplied during the creation of the state.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Determines whether the current state is valid.
      Returns:
      true if the state is valid, otherwise false

    • getValue

      public @Nullable R getValue()
      Retrieves the current value managed by this State.
      Returns:
      the current value of the property.

      public boolean isRequired()
      Determines whether the state is marked as required.
      Returns:
      true if the state is required; false otherwise

    • setValue

      public void setValue(@Nullable R arg)
      Sets a new value for the property managed by this State.
      Parameters:
      arg - the new value to be assigned to the property

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Tests if the control's base value is null.

      In most controls, there will be no difference between a control's base value and its actual value. An example where both differ is an input field for numbers where the base value is the text entered into the input and the value is the text converted to a number. When conversion fails, the number value will cleared or at least not updated. To distuigish whether nothingg has been entered at all or some invalid input was entered that maps to null, we use the base value.

      Returns:
      true, if the base value is null or the empty string
